If there are past habits that cannot be eliminated, you should teach this person to single-mindedly recite my Buddha's crown light MahÄsattva-dhÄraá¹‡Ä«, the unsurpassed divine mantra. This is the TathÄgata's invisible crown mark, the effortless mind-Buddha that emits radiance from the crown, and the mind mantra spoken by the one sitting on a jeweled lotus flower. Moreover, in your past lives, you and MÄtaá¹…gÄ« have had karmic relations through many eons, and the habits of affection and love are not from one lifetime or one eon.
When I proclaim it once, the mind of affection will be forever freed and you will become an arhat.
She is just a prostitute without any intention to cultivate, yet the divine power secretly assists her in quickly realizing no-more-learning.
How much more so for you and the assembly of Å›rÄvakas who seek the supreme vehicle and will definitely attain Buddhahood?
It is like throwing dust against the wind - what difficulty is there?

If there are those in the Dharma-ending age who wish to sit in the Way-place, they should first uphold the pure precepts of a bhiká¹£u. They must choose a pure and foremost Å›ramaá¹‡a as their teacher. If they do not encounter a truly pure monk, their precepts and observances will certainly not be accomplished. After the precepts are accomplished, they should wear new clean clothes, burn incense, dwell in seclusion, and recite this mind-dharma and the Buddha's spoken divine mantra one hundred and eight times. Then they should establish the boundary and set up the Way-place, and request the unsurpassed TathÄgatas presently dwelling in the lands of the ten directions to emit the light of great compassion and come to sprinkle their heads with it.

In this way, in the Dharma-ending age, pure bhiká¹£us, bhiká¹£uá¹‡Ä«s, and laypeople who have extinguished greed and lust and uphold the Buddha's pure precepts, will give rise to the bodhisattva vows in the Way-place. They will bathe and practice the Way six times a day. If they do this without sleeping for twenty-one days, I will personally appear before them, rub their heads in comfort, and cause them to awaken.

I have received the unsurpassed compassionate teachings of the TathÄgata, and my mind has been enlightened. I know that I will cultivate and realize the accomplishment of the path of no more learning;
In the Dharma-ending age, how should practitioners establish a ritual arena and form a boundary in accordance with the pure rules of the World-Honored Buddha?

If people in the Dharma-ending age wish to establish a ritual arena, first obtain a powerful white ox from the snow mountains, which eats the fragrant grass with abundant fat and grease in the mountains. This ox only drinks the clear water from the snow mountains. Its dung is fine and can be mixed with sandalwood to smear the ground;

If it is not from the snow mountains, the ox's dung is foul-smelling and cannot be used to smear the ground. Elsewhere, on level ground, dig down five feet below the surface, obtain the yellow soil, and mix it with sandalwood, agarwood, benzoin, olibanum, turmeric, lac, pine resin, nutgrass, sweet flag, and henbane. Grind these ten ingredients to make a fine powder, mix it with the soil to make mud, and smear it on the ground of the arena.
The octagonal altar is one zhang and six feet in size, with a golden, silver, copper, or wooden lotus flower placed in the center of the altar.
In the center of the flower, a bowl is placed, first filled with dew collected in the eighth month. In the water, any available flower petals are placed.
Eight round mirrors are placed in each of the eight directions, surrounding the flower and bowl. Outside the mirrors,
sixteen lotus flowers are erected, with sixteen incense burners placed between the flowers. The incense burners are

adorned and only agarwood is burned, without allowing the fire to be seen. White cow's milk is placed in sixteen vessels, and the milk is used to makeğŸ”½pancakes, as well as various sugar, oil cakes, milk porridge, ghee, honey, ginger,
pure ghee, pure honey, and various fruits and food, such as grapes and rock candy.
Various supreme foods are placed outside the lotus flowers, each with sixteen surrounding the flowers.
They are offered to the buddhas and great bodhisattvas at each meal;

If it is midnight, take half a pint of honey and three pints of ghee. In front of the altar, separately set up a small fire stove, and with dÅ«rvÄ grass, boil fragrant water to bathe the charcoal, burning it until it is fiercely blazing. Throw the ghee and honey into the flaming stove and burn them until the smoke is exhausted, offering it to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.
Cause banners and flowers to be hung all around the four sides outside. In the hall of the altar, arrange images of the TathÄgatas and Bodhisattvas of the ten directions on the four walls;
You should hang images of Vairocana, ÅšÄkyamuni, Maitreya, Aká¹£obhya, and AmitÄbha on the main axis;
The images of AvalokiteÅ›vara of the Great Transformations, together with Vajragarbha, are placed on the left and right;
Indra, BrahmÄ, Ucchuá¹£ma, and RÄhula, the various Aá¹­avika, PiÅ›Äca, and Yaká¹£a, and the Four Heavenly Kings, etc., are hung on the sides of the door, placed on the left and right.
Also, take eight mirrors and hang them upside down in the air, opposite the mirrors placed in the ritual arena, so that their reflections intersect with each other.

During the first seven days, sincerely bow to the Tathagatas of the ten directions, the great Bodhisattvas, and the Arhats, and always recite the mantra and circumambulate the altar with utmost sincerity, doing it one hundred and eight times each time.
During the second seven days, single-mindedly and continuously give rise to the Bodhisattva vows without interruption. In my Vinaya, there are previously taught methods for this;
during the third seven days, for the twelve periods of the day, single-mindedly uphold the Buddha's mantra;

when the fourth seven days arrive, the Tathagatas of the ten directions will simultaneously appear at the point where the mirror reflections intersect. Receiving the Buddha's empowerment on the crown of the head, one will then cultivate the samadhi in the ritual arena, enabling those who cultivate in the degenerate age to have a clear and pure body and mind, just like lapis lazuli.
If among the ten bhiká¹£us who originally received the precepts and were in the same assembly as this bhiká¹£u, there is even one who is impure, then such a ritual arena will often not be successful.

After three seven-day periods, sitting upright and peacefully abiding for one hundred days, those with sharp faculties will attain the stage of stream-entry without rising from their seats. Even if their holy fruits have not yet been accomplished, they will be certain that they will become buddhas without error.
This is how the ritual arena should be established, as you have asked.
Ä€nanda bowed at the Buddha's feet and said to the Buddha:
Since I left home, relying on the Buddha's affection, I sought much learning but did not realize non-action.
When I encountered the evil spells of the Brahma Heaven, although my mind was clear, I was powerless to act on my own. I was fortunate to meet MaÃ±juÅ›rÄ« and was liberated.
Although I received the Buddha's crown mantra from the TathÄgata, I secretly obtained its power but have not yet heard it directly.

May the Greatly Compassionate One please explain it again for the sake of those who practice in this assembly, and for those in the future who are in the cycle of rebirth, so that they may receive the Buddha's secret sound and be liberated in body and mind.
At that time, the entire great assembly made obeisance and waited to hear the secret words of the TathÄgata.

At that time, the World-Honored One emitted a hundred-treasure light from the crown of flesh on his head. In the light, a thousand-petaled jeweled lotus emerged. A transformed TathÄgata sat in the jeweled lotus, with ten paths of a hundred-treasure light radiating from his head. Each light universally manifested ten koá¹­Ä«s of nayutas of adamantine secret traces, holding up mountains and maces, pervading the realm of space. The great assembly looked up in awe and love, seeking the Buddha's protection, listening single-mindedly to the TathÄgata with the invisible crown of the head, expounding the divine mantra.

To the right, these mantra phrases total four hundred and thirty-nine phrases.
This Buddha's crown radiance aggregate Sitatapatra secret dhÄraá¹‡Ä« subtle chapter phrases give rise to all Buddhas of the ten directions.
The TathÄgatas of the ten directions attain supreme perfect enlightenment by relying on this mantra heart;
The TathÄgatas of the ten directions subdue demons and restrain non-Buddhists by grasping this mantra heart;
The TathÄgatas of the ten directions sit on jeweled lotus flowers and respond to dust-mote lands by riding this mantra heart;
The TathÄgatas of the ten directions turn the great Dharma wheel in dust-mote lands by containing this mantra heart;

The TathÄgatas of the ten directions, upholding this mantra-heart, are able to bestow predictions by touching the head in the ten directions. Even if their own fruits are not yet accomplished, they will receive predictions from the Buddhas in the ten directions.

The TathÄgatas of the ten directions, relying on this mantra-heart, are able to deliver from various sufferings in the ten directions, namely the sufferings of the hells, hungry ghosts, animals, blindness, deafness, muteness, encountering those one hates, separation from loved ones, the suffering of not obtaining what one desires, the five aggregates being rampant, and the simultaneous liberation from major and minor calamities. In times of danger from thieves, armies, kings, prisons, wind, water, fire, hunger, thirst, and poverty, they are instantly dispelled upon being thought of.

The TathÄgatas of the ten directions, following this mantra-heart, are able to serve spiritual benefactors in the ten directions, making offerings according to their wishes in the four modes of deportment. In the assemblies of Ganges-sand-like TathÄgatas, they are promoted to be great Dharma princes.

The TathÄgatas of the ten directions, practicing this mantra-heart, are able to accept close causes in the ten directions, causing those of the lesser vehicles to hear the secret canon without giving rise to fear.
The TathÄgatas of the ten directions recite this mantra-heart, attain supreme enlightenment, sit under the bodhi tree, and enter great nirvÄá¹‡a;
The TathÄgatas of the ten directions transmit this mantra-heart, and after their nirvÄá¹‡a, entrust the Buddha's teachings to be ultimately upheld, and the pure precepts are all purified.

If I were to explain this Buddha's crown radiance-gathering prajÃ±Ä-dhÄraá¹‡Ä« mantra from dawn to dusk, with the sounds continuously connected, and the words and phrases not repeated in the middle, even if I were to continue for eons as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, I still would not be able to finish it.

It is also said that this mantra is called the TathÄgata's crown. You who are still learning and have not yet ended saá¹ƒsÄra, if you give rise to the sincere aspiration to attain arhatship, and do not uphold this mantra while sitting in the place of practice, it will be impossible for you to keep your body and mind far away from all demonic affairs.

If in all worlds, in whatever countries, all beings according to the country, on birch bark, conch shells, paper, silk, or white cloth, write this mantra, store it in a fragrant pouch, and this person's mind is confused and unable to recite or remember it, or if they wear it on their body or write it in their home, know that this person will be able to live out their full lifespan without being harmed by any poisons.
I now tell you this mantra again, to save the world and attain great fearlessness, and to perfect the supramundane wisdom of sentient beings.

If after my nirvÄá¹‡a, sentient beings in the Dharma-ending age are able to recite it themselves or teach others to recite it, know that such sentient beings who recite and uphold this mantra will not be burned by fire, drowned in water, harmed by great or small poisons, and so forth, and will not be afflicted by the evil spells of dragons, gods, ghosts, spirits, demons, or sprites, and will attain right samÄdhi.

All curses, evil spells, poisons, gold poisons, silver poisons, poisonous vapors from plants, trees, insects, snakes, and myriad things, will become the taste of nectar when they enter the mouth of this person. All evil stars, ghosts, spirits, and malicious people will not be able to do harm to such a person.
The evil ghost kings, including VinÄyakas and their retinues, will all be deeply grateful and will always provide protection.

You should know that this mantra is always accompanied by 84,000 nayutas of koá¹­is of Ganges sands of Vajra-garbha kings, each with their own retinue of vajra assemblies. Even if a sentient being, with a distracted mind and not in samÄdhi, remembers and recites this mantra, these vajra kings will always follow that good man, let alone those with a definite bodhicitta.

These Vajra Bodhisattva Treasury Kings, with their essence, mind, and speed, give rise to their spiritual consciousness. At that time, the person's mind can remember the eighty-four thousand Ganges River sands of kalpas, thoroughly understand and be free from doubt, from the first kalpa up to their final body. In life after life, they will not be born as yaká¹£as, rÄká¹£asas, pÅ«tanas, kumbhÄá¹‡á¸as, piÅ›Äcas, or other hungry ghosts, with or without form, with or without thought, in such evil places;
If these good men and women read, recite, write, copy, carry, or hide it, and make various offerings, they will not be born in poor, lowly, or unhappy places kalpa after kalpa;

Even if these sentient beings do not personally create meritorious karma, the merit and virtue of the TathÄgatas of the ten directions will all be bestowed upon this person, enabling them to be reborn together with the Buddhas in the same place for eons as numerous as the sands in the Ganges River, asaá¹ƒkhyeya, and inexpressibly inexpressible eons, and to cultivate together with immeasurable merit and virtue, like a heap of agada medicine, forever inseparable.
Therefore, it can purify the precepts of those who have violated them;ğŸ”½those who have not yet received the precepts will be able to receive them;
those who are not diligent will become diligent;
those who lack wisdom will attain wisdom;
those who are impure will quickly attain purity;
those who do not observe the precepts will naturally fulfill the precepts.

When this good man upholds this mantra, even if he violates the precepts before receiving it, after upholding the mantra, all his broken precepts, whether grave or minor, will be instantly eradicated;

Even if one drinks alcohol and eats the five pungent roots and various impurities, all Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, Vajra, celestial immortals, and spirits will not consider it a transgression. Even if one wears impure, tattered, and worn-out clothes, every action and every moment of abiding will be the same as pure.
Even if one does not set up an altar or enter the ritual arena, and also does not practice, reciting and upholding this mantra will be the same as the merits of entering the altar and practicing.

If one commits the five heinous crimes with immediate retribution, or the four grave offenses and eight grave offenses of bhiká¹£us and bhiká¹£uá¹‡Ä«s, reciting this mantra will be like a fierce wind scattering sand and gravel, completely eliminating them without a trace.

If there are sentient beings who, for immeasurable and countless eons, have all kinds of light and heavy offenses and karmic hindrances, and have not yet been able to repent of them from past lives, if they are able to read, recite, copy, and carry this mantra on their bodies, or if they establish it in their residences, gardens, or pavilions, then such accumulated karma will be like snow melting in hot water, and before long they will all attain the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

If there are women who have not yet given birth to children and wish to give birth, if they are able to wholeheartedly recollect this mantra or carry this sitatapatra on their bodies, they will give birth to children with blessings and wisdom;
Those who seek long life will quickly attain long life;
Those who wish to quickly perfect the fruits of retribution will quickly attain perfection;
The same is true for life, body, appearance, and strength.
After death, they will be reborn in the lands of the ten directions according to their wishes, and will definitely not be reborn in borderlands or low-caste families, let alone in mixed forms.

If there are countries, prefectures, counties, or villages suffering from famine, epidemics, or warfare, or if there are difficulties such as bandits, thieves, disputes, or other calamities, write this divine mantra and place it at the four gates of the city, as well as on various shrines or flagpoles, and have the sentient beings of that country welcome this mantra, worship it with a sincere mind, and have each person carry it on their person or place it in their dwelling. All calamities and misfortunes will be completely eliminated.

Wherever this mantra is present, the devas and nÄgas will rejoice, the wind and rain will come at the right time, the five grains will be abundant, and the people will be peaceful and happy. It will also be able to suppress all evil stars and prevent calamities and hindrances caused by strange phenomena in the various directions. People will not die prematurely, and shackles, handcuffs, and chains will not bind their bodies. Day and night they will sleep peacefully and never have nightmares.

In this SahÄ world there are eighty-four thousand calamitous evil stars, with the twenty-eight lunar mansions and four great evil stars as their leaders. There are also eight great evil stars that serve as their masters. They take on various forms when they appear in the world, and are able to bring about various calamities for sentient beings. Where this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« is present, they are all destroyed. Within a radius of twelve yojanas, it becomes a protected area, and all evil calamities can never enter.

Therefore, the TathÄgata proclaims this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« to protect beginners in the future who enter samÄdhi. Their bodies and minds will be at ease and they will attain great peace and security. No ghosts, spirits, or enemies from beginningless time, old karmic debts, or past misfortunes will come to disturb or harm them.

You and all the learners in the assembly, as well as all future practitioners, relying on my ritual arena and upholding the precepts according to the Dharma, encountering a pure Sangha for the precepts you receive, and not giving rise to doubt or regret in upholding this mantra, these good men and women will not attain spiritual powers in this body born of their parents, and the Tathagatas of the ten directions will be telling lies.
Having said this, immeasurable hundreds of thousands of vajra-holders in the assembly joined their palms and bowed their heads to the Buddha, saying:
As the Buddha has said, we will sincerely protect and guard such practitioners of enlightenment.
At that time, Brahma King, Indra, and the Four Heavenly Kings also bowed their heads to the Buddha in unison and said to the Buddha:
If there are such good people who cultivate and study, we will wholeheartedly and sincerely protect and guard them, enabling them to accomplish their wishes in this lifetime.

Furthermore, innumerable yaká¹£a generals, rÄká¹£asa kings, pÅ«tana kings, kumbhÄá¹‡á¸a kings, piÅ›ÄcÄ« kings, piÅ›Äca kings, and other great ghost kings and ghost leaders also joined their palms and bowed to the Buddha, saying:
We also vow to protect and uphold this person, enabling them to quickly perfect the mind of enlightenment.

Furthermore, innumerable sun and moon celestial beings, wind masters, rain masters, cloud masters, thunder masters, and lightning masters, as well as the officials who inspect the years and the stars and their retinue, also bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet in the assembly and said to the Buddha:
We will also protect this practitioner, enabling them to establish the ritual arena and attain fearlessness.

Furthermore, innumerable mountain spirits, sea spirits, all land and water spirits, spirits of myriad things that move in the air, as well as the wind god kings and formless realm gods, also bowed their heads to the TathÄgata at the same time and said to the Buddha:
We will also protect this practitioner and enable them to attain enlightenment without any demonic affairs.

At that time, Vajra Treasury Kings Bodhisattvas as numerous as the sands of 84,000 Ganges Rivers, in the great assembly, immediately rose from their seats, bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet, and said to the Buddha:

As for our kind, we have long attained enlightenment by cultivating meritorious deeds, but do not enter nirvana. We always follow this mantra to rescue and protect those who cultivate the samÄdhi and practice correctly in the Dharma-ending Age.

Those who cultivate the mind in this way and seek right concentration, whether in the ritual arena or elsewhere, even if their minds are scattered and they play in the villages, our retinue will always follow and guard this person. Even if the demon king or MaheÅ›vara seeks an opportunity, they will never find one. All the minor ghosts and spirits will stay ten yojanas away from this good person;
Excluding those who have given rise to the aspiration to joyfully cultivate meditation.

If such evil demons or their retinue come to disturb these good people, I will smash their heads to pieces like dust with my precious cudgel, always causing these people to accomplish their wishes as they wish.
Ä€nanda then rose from his seat, bowed his head to the Buddha's feet, and said to the Buddha:

We are foolish and dull-witted, fond of much learning, and have not yet sought liberation from the defiled mind. Having received the Buddha's compassionate instruction and obtained proper cultivation, our bodies and minds are joyful and we have gained great benefit.
In cultivating and realizing the Buddha's samÄdhi in this way, before reaching nirvÄá¹‡a, what is called the stage of dry wisdom?
To what gradual stage does one attain the name of practicing cultivation?
To what place does one go to be called entering the stages?
What is called a bodhisattva of equal enlightenment?
Having said this, he prostrated with his whole body on the ground, and the great assembly single-mindedly awaited the Buddha's compassionate voice, gazing up with wide-open eyes.
At that time, the World-Honored One praised Ä€nanda, saying:

You are able to universally cultivate the samÄdhi for the sake of the great assembly and all sentient beings in the latter age who seek the Great Vehicle, from the stage of ordinary beings to great nirvÄá¹‡a, and to reveal the supreme path of correct practice.
Now listen attentively, and I will explain it for you.
Ä€nanda and the great assembly joined their palms, emptied their minds, and silently accepted the teaching.

You should know that the wondrous nature is perfect and bright, free from all names and characteristics. Originally there are no worlds or sentient beings. Due to delusion there is birth, and due to birth there is cessation. Birth and cessation are called delusion. The cessation of delusion is called true. This is called the TathÄgata's unsurpassed enlightenment and great nirvÄá¹‡a, the two names for the turning of the basis.

If you now wish to cultivate true samÄdhi and go straight to the TathÄgata's great nirvÄá¹‡a, you should first recognize the two inverted causes of sentient beings and worlds. When inversion does not arise, this is the TathÄgata's true samÄdhi.
What is meant by the inversion of sentient beings?
Because the nature of the mind is luminous and perfect,
the nature manifests due to illumination, and false views arise from the nature.

From the ultimate non-existence, the final existence is formed. This existence has no cause, and the appearance of the abode has no basis. Based on this non-abiding, the world and all beings are established. Delusion about the original perfect clarity gives rise to false thoughts. The nature of falsity has no substance and is not based on anything.

If one wishes to return to the true, once the desire for truth arises, it is already not true. The true nature of suchness is not true, and seeking to return to it becomes a false appearance. Not arising, not abiding, not mind, not phenomena, mutually giving rise to the power of arising, perfuming to form karma. Karmic affinities attract each other, and due to the mutual destruction and arising of karma, there are inversions of sentient beings.
What is meant by the inversion of the world?
This existence has parts and falsely arises. Based on this, the realm is established;
The non-cause as the cause, the non-abiding as the abiding, the non-flowing as the flowing, are based on this to form the world.

The three times and four directions intermingle, and the transformations of beings form twelve categories. Therefore, in the world, sound arises from movement, form arises from sound, smell arises from form, touch arises from smell, taste arises from touch, and the knowledge of dharmas arises from taste. Because the six deluded thoughts form karmic natures, they are divided into twelve and revolve in this way. Therefore, in the world, sound, smell, taste, and touch exhaust the twelve transformations and form one cycle.

Riding on this inverted wheel, there are in the world oviparous birth, viviparous birth, moisture-born birth, and spontaneous birth; form and formlessness; thought and no thought; neither form nor no form; neither thought nor no thought.
Due to the inverted movement of false reincarnation in the world, the combination of qi forms eighty-four thousand chaotic thoughts of flying and sinking.
Thus, there are those born from eggs, such as kalala, who transmigrate through the lands, filling the realms with fish, birds, turtles, and snakes.
Due to the inverted desire of the mixed and defiled cyclic existence of the world, there are eighty-four thousand horizontal and vertical chaotic thoughts that come together and form.
Thus, there are those born from wombs, such as arbuda, who transmigrate through the lands, filling the realms with humans, animals, dragons, and immortals.
Due to the inverted destinies of attachment and cyclic existence in the world, there are eighty-four thousand chaotic thoughts of turning over and over that come together and form softness.
Thus, there are those born from moisture, such as peÅ›Ä«, who transmigrate through the lands, filling the realms with wriggling and crawling creatures.
Due to the inverted borrowing of transformation and cyclic existence in the world, there are eighty-four thousand chaotic thoughts of new and old that come together and form contact.
Thus, there are those born by transformation, such as ghana, who transmigrate through the lands, filling the realms with those that molt and fly.
Due to the inverted attachment of obstruction and cyclic existence in the world of causes, they combine and attach to form eighty-four thousand chaotic thoughts of refined radiance.
Thus, there are the formless karman-souls that circulate in the lands, with the various kinds of auspicious and inauspicious refined essence filling the universe.
Due to the inverted delusion of dissipation and cyclic existence in the world of causes, they combine and form eighty-four thousand chaotic thoughts of hidden darkness.
Thus, there are the formless karman-souls that circulate in the lands, with the various kinds of empty, scattered, and sunken [beings] filling the universe.
Due to the inverted reflection of deception and cyclic existence in the world of causes, they combine and form eighty-four thousand chaotic thoughts of latent attachment.
Thus, there are the conceptual karman-souls that circulate in the lands, with the various kinds of spiritual beings, ghosts, and spirits filling the universe.
Due to the inverted delusion of dullness and cyclic existence in the world of causes, they combine and form eighty-four thousand chaotic thoughts of withered dryness.
Thus there are formless beings who transform into earth, wood, metal, and stone in the lands, filling the universe.
Due to the false inversion of mutual dependence in the world, there are eighty-four thousand deluded thoughts of dependence and confusion that combine and form attachments.
Thus there are beings with form who transform into formless beings in the lands, such as jellyfish that use shrimp for eyes, filling the universe.
Due to the inversion of attraction in the world, there are eighty-four thousand deluded thoughts of summoning and calling that combine and form attachments through spells.
Thus there are formless beings who transform into beings with form in the lands, such as those born through curses and evil spells, filling the universe.
Due to the inversion of deception in the world, there are eighty-four thousand deluded thoughts of mutual deception that combine and form attachments through various means.

Thus, there are those with the appearance of having thoughts but not really having thoughts, who transform and take on the form of a Gandharva in the lands. They are like the Polu and others who transform into different forms, filling the world.

Because of the wheel of enmity and killing that revolves due to the inverted attachment to killing in the world, they combine with strange beings to form the eighty-four thousand thoughts of eating their parents.

Thus, there are those with the appearance of having no thoughts but not really having no thoughts, who transform and take on the form of a Gandharva in the lands. They are like the earth-owl and others who attach to clods of earth as their children, and the mirror-breaking bird that holds the fruit of a poisonous tree to be its child. When the child is born, both parents are eaten by it. They fill the world.

These are called the twelve kinds of beings.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:ğŸ”½The Great Buddha's Crown, the Sutra of the ÅšÅ«raá¹ƒgama SamÄdhi, Scroll 7, I take refuge in the Sugata, the Arhat, the Samyak-Saá¹ƒbuddhağŸ”½The Buddha's billions of samÄdhis
